-Highly professional and focused, able work under pressure to meet deadlines; Specialties:research, product development, clinical trials coordination, regulatory, 510(k) submission, manufacturing, data analysis, data management, project management, multifunctional project coordination, Microsoft Project, MS Office Experience Project Manager Stanford University School of Medicine/Division of Blood and Marrow Transplantation January 2010  – Present (5 years 8 months) Influenza Project Coordinator II Arbor Vita Corp June 2008  –  November 2009  (1 year 6 months) Coordinated the development of the FDA approved AV Avantage A/H5N1 Flu Test - a novel rapid diagnostic test against avian flu. Took over the project in the clinical phase. Successfully organized and managed manufacturing of three clinical lots of product both in-house and OEM. Coordinated the schedules and deliverables of several contract manufacturers, as well as in-house QA and QC efforts. Actively participated in organization and management of clinical trials per FDA guidelines. Organized the logistics of running clinical trials, such as resource allocation, training, materials procurement and shipping to sites including NAMRU-3; Actively participated in preparations for the 510(k) submission of AV Avantage A/H5N1 Flu Test, by summarizing and organizing the data, and writing submission sections. Maintained active dialogue with the FDA and the clinical sites to ensure the company's work meets FDA's expectations for approval. After FDA clearance participated in setting up commercial manufacturing of the product. Project Coordinator I - HPV Arbor Vita Corporation January 2007  –  June 2008  (1 year 6 months) Coordinated the development of a novel rapid diagnostic test for the detection of cervical cancer and pre-cancer. Applied own scientific background to lead the development and validation of the commercial prototype in clinical studies. Organized and managed manufacturing of 15,000 prototype devices both in-house and out-sourced. Successfully conducted the technology transfer to CMOs and managed the manufacturing and QC efforts to ensure product quality. Worked with multiple CMOs in parallel; maintained the schedules and ensured timely deliverables. In collaboration with PATH, Seattle, WA, successfully organized two clinical studies in India and China to validate the device. Closely monitored the testing progress and analyzed the data with the senior scientists. The results of the clinical studies were presented in a poster and an oral presentation at 2007 IPV Conference in Beijing, China. Other responsibilities included establishing collaborations with private ObGYN practices and non-profit organizations to obtain human clinical samples for internal R&D and product development efforts. Worked with IRBs to get necessary documentation and approval for specimens use. Research Associate II Arbor Vita Corp October 2003  –  January 2007  (3 years 4 months) Worked on researching and characterization of novel Mabs against oncogenic E6 proteins of 20 HPV strains. Actively participated in creation of a unique panel of HPV-E6 antibodies. Worked on creation of HPV Dx test from proof-of-concept to clinical trials. Studied and optimized E6 protein detection in clinical samples. Successfully transferred technology to collaborators with high reproducibility of experimental data. Successfully applied AVC's proprietary PDZ technology in HPV Rx project. Experimentally showed interruption of HPV oncogenic pathway upon small molecule inhibition of PL:PDZ binding. Worked on assay development in both HPV Dx and Rx projects. Researched effects of PDZ inhibiting drugs on various cancers. Research Associate II Stanford University Medical Center January 2003  –  June 2003  (6 months) Worked on researching and characterization of a panel of 10 HMAbs against E1 and E2 proteins of Hepatitis C virus. Performed Ab affinity studies to live HCV virions, as well as to artificially expressed viral epitopes from different HCV genotypes. Carried out project from epitope vector construction to Ab affinity analysis by FACS. Performed epitope mapping projects by FACS analysis and sequencing. Conducted an HCV-induced cell fusion study by intracellular staining. Studied viral attachment and infection of various cell lines by means of confocal microscopy and digital cell imaging. Research Associate II Abgenix, Inc November 2001  –  November 2002  (1 year 1 month) Worked on researching and applying the intracellular antibody (Intrabody) technology towards target validation studies. Summary Experienced Project Manager consistently delivering technology, business and educational solutions with organizational efficiency, strong program/project management and cost control. Self-motivated, productive, organized, responsible, action oriented and accomplished at moving projects through to completion. Demonstrated ability to close out projects on time, on budget, while meeting project objectives. Ability to interact positively with and build consensus among a diverse group of colleagues, clients and senior leadership.  
 
Extensive experience in network and security system configuration, performance, capacity, incident, problem and change management. Proven ability to develop and maintain strong vendor and customer relationships. Has reputation for professionalism, integrity and clear communication style. Expert knowledge of network solutions including VoIP, Video, UCC, Cloud and Mobility.
